text:
The server-status page incorrectly formats some large positive values as negative numbers.

About half of the values in the Child and Slot columns are formatted as negative values.  This is wrong. 
All values in these columns should be positive integers.
What platform?  Can you attach an example page showing this?

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
Oh, it's just 32-bit integer overflow in the signed off_t counters.  In 2.1.x
and later the counters are 64-bit by default, so it at least takes "a while"
longer to overflow.

We could change it to cast to an unsigned integer at some point but it'd still
be a lie, I don't think it's really worth changing this in 2.0.

What we are observing here is 31-bit overflow, not 32-bit overflow.  Yes, 32-bot overflow will come 
later.  But this bug makes it twice as likely to be wrong.

Casting a signed int to an unsigned int doesn't do anything to the underlying bits.  It just tells the 
compiler that some operations aren't possible:  if ((unsigned int) x < 0), for example.  But nothing 
changes at run-time.

The bug is in the formatting code.   Somebody probably called sprintf with %d instead of %u.  That's a 
very common mistake.  

The fact that a '-' sign shows up is completely a bug in the function that formats the value for printing.  
Somebody thought that counts should be treated as signed; they're not.  It's a formatting thing.
